intro: Cyclosorus multisorus, commonly known as the slender water clover, is a freshwater aquatic plant characterized by its intricate, branching structure. It belongs to the family Marsileaceae and is native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. The plant features small, floating leaves that are typically four-lobed, resembling a clover leaf in appearance. It thrives in still or slow-moving waters and is often found in ponds and marshes. Cyclosorus multisorus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small organisms and contributing to water quality through oxygen production.
